text.text_translated:
Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop.
She was a young girl in Bangladesh.
A child from another country came to visit.
The child was playing with the hula hoop.
Wasfia watched. She wanted to play, but she did not.
People in her country believed girls should not play with hula hoops.
They also believed girls should not ride bikes.

Now Wasfia is one of a few people in the world.
She climbed the Seven tall mountains.
These are big mountains like Everest and Kilimanjaro.
She was the first to hula-hoop on every tall mountain.
She did this for a reason.
She wanted to help women and girls be strong.
Her country tells girls not to do sport.
